review_content: Jedno z niewielu piw, których nie udało mi się dopić. Śmiardziało z bardzo nieprzyjemnym posmakiem (chyba typowy dla bezalkoholowych, bo już któryś raz się z nim spotkałem).
Eindelijk eens een alcoholloos pilsje wat lekker smaakt en ruikt, een blind test had ik deze er niet uitgehaald. Lekker tussendoor en bij eten.

Coloração palha,límpida ,espuma com boa formação e manutenção,boa carbonatação,aroma levemente maltado,sabor remete á Heineken original porém um tanto aguado,final seco. Zero Álcool bem feita,boa opção,gostei.

The aroma is weak but has enough of that European style malt and hops to pass for beer. The appearance is pale gold with a medium head. The taste is like the aroma weak but more beer than a great many NA beers. The palate is thin but acceptable from a generous amount of tiny bubbles. Overall it's very easy to drink and inoffensive, you could do a lot worse however there isn't much here.
Złote, klarowne, całkiem ładna, średniopęcherzykowa piana. Aromat słodowo-kartonowy. W smaku lagerowo, słodowo, pilsowe akcenty ale nie grają pierwszych skrzypiec.

Dose 0,33l: Golden, klar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; malzige + leicht fruchtige Nase, malzige Süße, dezente Zitrusnoten, dezente Hopfenaromen, kräftig Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, Brot, Brotteig; dezent fruchtiger + kräftig malziger Körper, dezente Hopfenaromen, Malz, grünes Getreide, spritzig, mittlere Kohlensäure, kräftige Hefearomen, Maische, Brot; hefig-malziger Nachgang

Can 0.33l from Albert Heijn, The Netherlands. 21.7.2021. Pour it clear golden color with medium white head. Aroma sourish dirt dishwasher sponge. Taste similar to aroma, some slick and weird bitter finish, try to had few sips but not for my taste to be honest.

we hadden geen 0,0 ik kon gwn niet twee keer dezelfde bier reviewen. jordy had blikkies thuis en we hebben adam sandler en casanova’s gekeken <3 ben in slaap gevallen op zijn schouder tijdens casanova’s het spijt me t was echt 5 uur ofzo

우선 다 만들어둔 맥주에서 에탄올만 추출하다보니 가격은 차이가 없으며

하이네켄 오리지널 특유의 가벼운 쌉싸름함과 텁텁함, 상쾌함까지 균형적인 맛을 구현했다고 하는데 사실상 맛은 다소 동떨어진 느낌으로 꿀물과 탄산수를 섞은 듯 했죠.

생각해보니 꿀물 맛이 느껴지는건 발효과정에서도 알콜 발생을 최소화하다보니 맥아즙에 있는 당들이 많이 남아서 그런걸까 싶구요.

맛이 없다라고 말하고 있긴하지만 사실 탄산수에 각종 향신료를 때려박아 맥주향을 낸 이상한 음료들보다는 훨씬 났습니다.

​TMI지만 특히 트림할때는 진짜를 마신 후와 같아서 '아 내가 맥주를 마시긴 마셨구나..' 싶었으며 

더불어 마시기전 냉동실에 30분 정도 넣어뒀다가 아주 차갑게 마시면 냉기파워로 하이네켄 오리지널의 맛이 나기도하는데 삼킬때의 요상한 맛까진 죽일 순 없더라구요. 즉 대부분의 맥주가 식으면 쉣이긴한데 무알콜 맥주는 특히 쉣이라는 것. 

고로 정말 특별히 술을 먹으면 안되는 상황이 아닌이상 굳이 안마실려고..
Pale colour, rocky head that stays for a while. Aroma is weak, mostly corn. Light bitterness. Feels watery. Not bad, just feels diluted.
Medium sweet & light bitter aroma. Clear pale golden with no head. Tart sour with a light dry finish. Light body, sticky texture & soft carbonation.
330ml can watching England thrash Ukraine 4 nil in the Euros. Expected a bit more lagery sweetness to this, but unfortunately it's just too light and empty for an AF lager.
Water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, yes it is water !

This one's special for me: 0.15l can, as a gift for Belgrade half-marathon. Perfect dose for non alcoholic beer, right?

I didn't want to pour it in a glass. Served cold. Made in Netherlands, which is real surprise for Serbian market.

Beer aroma. Extremely watery feel, alcohol is missing here for real. Weak but still pretty drinkable. Reminds of beer but I'd rather drink pure water than this.

(330ml bottle, Berlin. 09 May 2021)
AROMA: light malt, full grain bread, a bit of dank cave, barrel/wood, maybe a hint of coffee/tea
APPEARANCE: medium light golden yellow, not too light, minimal head with almost no residual, color is respectable for a pale lager but the rest is a bit blah. 
TASTE: very light bread/grain, lightly sweet, maybe corn and hints of under-ripe/green stone fruit, very muted berry/bubblegum, hardly any hops, some metal and green grass on the finish
PALATE: quite light, crisp but not very biting, finish is slightly dry and very neutral, maybe a tad numbing

OVERALL: not bad for a 0.0 beer. If it was as cheap as some of the available inexpensive german beers, I might drink this. Basically a fizzy beverage with soft beer characteristics. not terrible, just kinda plain.
Jedno z niewielu piw, których nie udało mi się dopić. Śmiardziało z bardzo nieprzyjemnym posmakiem (chyba typowy dla bezalkoholowych, bo już któryś raz się z nim spotkałem).
Eindelijk eens een alcoholloos pilsje wat lekker smaakt en ruikt, een blind test had ik deze er niet uitgehaald. Lekker tussendoor en bij eten.

Coloração palha,límpida ,espuma com boa formação e manutenção,boa carbonatação,aroma levemente maltado,sabor remete á Heineken original porém um tanto aguado,final seco. Zero Álcool bem feita,boa opção,gostei.

The aroma is weak but has enough of that European style malt and hops to pass for beer. The appearance is pale gold with a medium head. The taste is like the aroma weak but more beer than a great many NA beers. The palate is thin but acceptable from a…
Złote, klarowne, całkiem ładna, średniopęcherzykowa piana. Aromat słodowo-kartonowy. W smaku lagerowo, słodowo, pilsowe akcenty ale nie grają pierwszych skrzypiec.

Dose 0,33l: Golden, klar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; malzige + leicht fruchtige Nase, malzige Süße, dezente Zitrusnoten, dezente Hopfenaromen, kräftig Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, Brot, Brotteig; dezent fruchtiger + kräftig malziger…

Can 0.33l from Albert Heijn, The Netherlands. 21.7.2021. Pour it clear golden color with medium white head. Aroma sourish dirt dishwasher sponge. Taste similar to aroma, some slick and weird bitter finish, try to had few sips but not for my taste to be honest.

we hadden geen 0,0 ik kon gwn niet twee keer dezelfde bier reviewen. jordy had blikkies thuis en we hebben adam sandler en casanova’s gekeken <3 ben in slaap gevallen op zijn schouder tijdens casanova’s het spijt me t was echt 5 uur ofzo
우선 다 만들어둔 맥주에서 에탄올만 추출하다보니 가격은 차이가 없으며 하이네켄 오리지널 특유의 가벼운 쌉싸름함과 텁텁함, 상쾌함까지 균형적인 맛을 구현…
Pale colour, rocky head that stays for a while. Aroma is weak, mostly corn. Light bitterness. Feels watery. Not bad, just feels diluted.
Medium sweet & light bitter aroma. Clear pale golden with no head. Tart sour with a light dry finish. Light body, sticky texture & soft carbonation.
330ml can watching England thrash Ukraine 4 nil in the Euros. Expected a bit more lagery sweetness to this, but unfortunately it's just too light and empty for an AF lager.
Water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, water, yes it is water !
This one's special for me: 0.15l can, as a gift for Belgrade half-marathon. Perfect dose for non alcoholic beer, right?…
(330ml bottle, Berlin. 09 May 2021) AROMA: light malt, full grain bread, a bit of dank cave, barrel/wood, maybe a hint of coffee/tea…

Bottle - 330ml. Boring blond body with a fading, white foamy head. Thin malty aroma with bready and skunky hints. Its watery taste carries rodden herbs and wet bread notes. Ends with a short metalic-like finish. Useless.

Wygląd: Złote, bez wyraźnej piany
Aromat: Brzeczka, zboża
Smak: Diacetyl, wodniste, kwaskowe, delikatnie słodowe
Somehow than regular Heineken. Bready, with a touch of apple and backed up by floral hops. Surprisingly drinkable.
Bottle. Golden beer with a whitish head. Malt and light mineral aroma. Sweet malt flavor. Medium-light bodied. Sweet malt and light grass linger.
Gute alkoholfreie Erfrischung. Man erkennt den typischen Heineken Geschmack sofort raus. Gutes Alkoholfreies
Kotona 1/2021. A bit watery and thin as excepted, but lacks any metallic or otherwise unpleasant aromas.

# 2399; 1/2021. Oxidation in aroma, skunk. Brilliant, light gold body; white tiny white head with bad retention. Sour-sweet, corny, hars herbal bitterness. Bad beer. 0,33 l, green bottle, supermarket, Pilsen (Bohemia, CZ).

33 cl. bottle at home. High flufy and lasting white head. Clear yellow golden body. Mild and weak fruity aroma. Salt dominated flavor with just a wee bit of hops bitterness, low carbonation, short finish.
Bottle from Rohan. Clear gold w/grainy aroma, light malty taste w/a spritzy finish. The mouthfeel is much better than most EtOH-reduced brews. Better than expected.
Can. Malty aroma and taste, grainy notes, light sourish notes, light to medium bitter. Light body, malty bitter finish. Average.
The beer has got a light golden colour with a small head and thin body. Aroma of bread and grains. Taste of grains, bread, citrus. Metallic finish.

As always with 0% beers, I went into this expecting a wierd, faux beer, and it tastes like Heineken, so I guess I was right. Worrying about the impact the 0% alcohol will have on the taste of a Heineken is like worrying about the window you broke to escape your burning home. It really makes no difference at all.

A friend of mine who can no longer drink “regular” beer and can now only have non-alcohol beer, said that he is surprised how well done some non-alcohol beers are these days. So I’ve decided to try a few myself, just to see what’s what.

Colour...clear gold with a thick white head. Nose...creamed corn, honey butter, spent grain and a faint wisp  of hops. Palate...plenty frothy to start with loads of corn and malted hot cereal. There’s just a teensie bit of hops, mostly on the mid palate and a fairly lengthy finish of corn based cold cereal. All in all, this tastes much like regular Heineken, which may be what the brewers were aiming for.

Bottle 30cl. Clear pale golden colour, good frothy white head, good retention and lacing, Aroma pilsner malt, grain. Taste medium sweet and light bitter, malty, grain. Light body, watery texture, soft carbonation, sweet aftertaste, metallic notes, all in all quite watery.

BB 22-03-2021. From a stubby poured a crystal clear golden amber with 2cm of bright white open foam that retained very well and laced very well. Aroma very malty and moderately sweet. Taste is very malty and moderately sweet with slight grain; best drunk cold as a slight underlying sourness develops as it warms; no real bitterness. Light body but surprizingly not watery. Smooth, crisp and clean with a short finish. At least it tastes like a beer.

330ml bottle into pint glass. From BWS, Glen Innes. Pours a pale amber with a large white frothy head. High fine carbonation. Faint aroma of tin and cornflakes. Very light body but not watery. Slight bitterness, hollow slightly sour finish. Not horrible, will suffice if no real beer available. Don't know how many you could drink.

est before July 2021.

Nice pale gold pour with a good head of foam.

I smelled the aroma of light struck beer as soon as I popped the cap. My nose does pick up some malty sweetness.

The taste does resemble regular Heineken and that's a plus. Malty, grainy, very light hint of bitterness.

Light body, no surprise there.

I was hoping that it would taste decent and it does.
Una cerveza con cuerpo ligero y sabor bastante leve. La malta casi imperceptible, aunque muy refrescante.

Taster. Poured clear pale color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Light grainy balanced aroma.  Light body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Light sweet flavor with a light sweet finish of short duration. This cold wet with no alcohol  beer met my low expectations

330 ml can from a local supermarket. Bubbly white head and clear golden colour. Aroma of corn and malt. Generally rather bland, light malt taste covered by sourness, and no hops for balance. Little lasting taste.
Pours clear yellow, no foam remaining. Barley aroma and taste. (Velp 202011)
Promo can 15 cl. Golden bubbly with small fastly disappearing white head. Slightly sour fruity aroma. Bit bitter, bit sour, some malty touch, lasting harsh bitter note. Watery.

Dégustée le 2020-09-28 chez ZiBo Dix30.                                                                                                                                                                          .

330ml can in Quebec, under "Heineken - Bière sans alcohol". Clean golden, with some nice tiny bubble carbonation and a creamy head that lasts a while, leaving some creamy lacing. The nose is pretty malty and sweet with notes of honey over the grains. Refreshing, crisp mouthfeel. The taste shows the same as the nose, but at least the sweetness is cut short. This is actually a real nice, drinkable no-alcohol beer that does not seem like one. Well-done.

Złote, klarowne, piana z początku obfita szybko opada niemal do zera, zostawiając minimalny lacing. W aromacie trochę mokrej szmaty, poza tym pustka. W smaku również puste, pojawia się tylko jakaś dziwna kwaskowatość.

(Can, from Systembolaget Vällingby, Stockholm) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of bread, honey, citrus, hay and hints of vegetables. Malty taste with bread, honey, hay, hints of citrus and a low bitterness in the finish. Light body, mainly dry. Decent low alcohol macro lager. Drinkable.

Can 15 cl. Pours a clear yellow with a tiny, white head. Sweet, wort-like aroma - unpleasant. Ligh body, some sweetish maltiness but also an odd banana or bubblegum note. Hardly any bitterness. Very surprised that Heineken cannot do better than this for a zero alcohol! 270820

Can, obtained because it was literally being handed out for free outside a grocery store, and "enjoyed" during a late night work session. Floral, cereal, watery, bit sweet, lingering unpleasant finish. Watery body. This is not good.
Bardzo nijakie, mało się w nim dzieje, taka woda z delikatnym posmakiem piwa. Bez wyczuwalnych wad.
Klarowne i złociste. Piana wysoka drobnopęcherzykowata. W aromacie mokre zboże i kwiaty. W smaku puste, wodniste. Jest słodowe i delikatnie kwaśne.
Istna ambrozja. Sporo aromatów brzeczkowo-miodowych, jakieś masełko. Goryczka równa MS/PG. Ujdzie w 30 st. C.
Gold pour, healthy foamy white with smattering of lace.  Nose is malt and light herbal.  Middle is light kilned malt, crisp apple, mild herbal  bitterness.  Finish is lightly bitter.  Nice NA.
Clear gold with a decent white head, malty grainy aroma, light body, crisp, skunky light citrus, dry finish, quite refreshing

33 cl bottle at Ruta 77, Madrid.

A pale golden pour with a thick, off-white head.

Aroma is mainly malty: cereal, cookies, porridge. Very little hops.

Soft, crisp, chewy. Not bad for a non-alcoholic.

5.1 oz can. Clear pale. Smells like beer. Palate is pleasantly fizzy. Easy going, can't detect the alcohol. Oh? There is no alky, sorry. Taste is a little cardboard. Comes across something like soda water with some cardboard in there. Not bad. Much better than those session IPA I've been doing lately.

11.2 oz. can bought at Total Wine - Melbourne, FL. Pours a crystal clear light gold color with a large white head and very good retention. Decent lacing. Looks like beer. Very skunky aroma. Tastes like a very light lager with a little skunk finish. More beer-like and more body than most N/As.

Aroma: Bubblegum. 
Flavour: Fruity sweet with bubblegum. 
Colour: Pale yellow with a white head. 
From: Can @ Bilka Tilst Jun. 2020.
Can. Clear pale golden color with a thick frothy white head. Mild aroma of grain. Sugary, taste. Thin body. Messy feel.

I will write this in acceptance that (other than Super Dry Zero) all zero beer is bad. So for that reason, as an alco-free beer, it isn't bad. Can from 7-11. Some malt and bitterness. Good carbonation....perhaps too much. The aftertaste is not nice.....sort of like dandelions...Reminds me of Suntory's effort at zero beer. But, as a none alco beer to quench the thirst , it isn't bad tbh.

Goudgeel bier met witte schuimkraag. Waterig qua mondgevoel. Wel verfrissend. In de nasmaak proef je zelfs iets van een gewone Heineken terug. Geen heel bijzonder bier, maar in de wetenschap dat het 0,0 is, dan is het prima te nuttigen. Geen vervelende nasmaak, zoals bij de meeste alcoholvrije bieren.
Flaska från livsmedelsbutik. Klar gyllengul vätska. Doft av söt malt och vitt bröd. Tunn och lite kemisk smak

Can at Sønder Boulevard.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Malty aroma of grain.
Malty flavour of grain with notes of bananas.
Light watery.

Green bottle poured a clear gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of straw, skunk and a hint of fruitiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, light skunk and a hint of citrus with a crisp dry finish.
Ærligt en god alkoholsfri bajer, hvem kan ikke lide den om morgenen. Man skal jo heller ikke være fuld hele tiden. Jeg kan ihvertfald bedre li den end carlsberg nordic.
Not bad if there is nothing else to drink during coronavirus prohibition 😀
Gold pour. Grainy and earthy nose. Grainy and sweet hop flavor. Palate is hoppy grain
Bottle from a local pupuseria: Grain nose, some cardboard. Crystal clear yellow, thin head. Grass and violets, light. Light body, easy carbonation.

Barwa słomkowa, piana drobno pęcherzykowa, szybko znika. Klarowne. Leciutki słomkowy aromat. W smaku mało wyraźne, lekka metaliczność. Plus za dobrze ukryty posmak bezalkoholowy. Równie ciekawe co zwykły Heineken.

Straw Golden with good foam!
Nose. Malt, with notes of fresh wort and grassy hops. (Almost indistinguishable from alcohol) There is some unpleasant defect.
Taste. Malt, (an unpleasant defect and tastes something like sourness) watery in the aftertaste hop bitterness.
Close to the alcohol version. But some kind of defect spoils the whole picture.
HG. Are you awake?  HG. Are you sleeping?  N/A not applicable. Sorry. No one is home.
Pours clear yellow with white head. Very sweet, malty, grassy and grainy. Heavy enough texture. Enjoyed it at first as a non-alcoholic option as I was driving, but it was not easy to finish
Słodowe, puste, brzeczkowe, lekkie, bardzo mocno wysycone, wodniste, niegodny większej uwagi.

330ml (0.0%) at home on 29 Dec 2019, from Tesco, Whitletts Road, Ayr (purchased 29 Dec 2019; bb 1 Aug 2020): sweet cereal, pale malty aroma, pale golden, thin white head, pretty pattern of lacing, cereal, grain flavour, very dry.

Aroma is korrelig, grasachtig, wortachtig, bloemig en licht citrusachtig. Uitzicht: helder goudkleurig bier met dunne schuimige witte kop en sprankelend uiterlijk. 
Smaakt licht zoet, korrelig, zwak citrusachtig, grasachtig, plantaardig en licht bitter. 
Mondgevoel: Licht lichaam, dunne textuur en levendig koolzuur.

Velice velice příjemné překvapení. Nealko od Heinekenu není skoro o nic horší než jeho klasická alkoholová verze. V některých faktorech je snad zejména díky silné sladovosti pivem snad ještě zajímavější.
Piwo klarowne słomkowe z białą pianą. W aromacie słabo, delikatnie słodowy. W smaku przyjemne słodowe, mało brzeczkowe. Wodniste ale nie ma tragedii. Jak na bezalkoholowe to naprawdę trzyma poziom.
Bright yellow color with thin white lacing head. Closely neutral, grassy aroma. Grassy, slightly grainy, sour, bit stale flavor. Low-medium sweet, grassy palate, thin body.
Not much for these non alcoholic beers, but if your craving a beer on a Tuesday, like I am now, then this one hits the spot.

Helder lichtgeel bier met schuim. Smaak is ondanks niet erg sterk toch verrassend goed, licht bitter en heeft niet de vervelende bijsmaak die veel 0.0 bieren wel hebben. Eigenlijk merk ik geen verschil in deze en de standaard versie.

33cl can from Carrefour market, Rue des Champs 27 in Brussels.
F: big, white, almost good retention.
C: pale gold, clear.
A: wort, metallic, bit grassy, grainy.
T: light malty base, bit peach, bready touch, bit iron, medium carbonation, taste is bit better than aroma yet why to drink this when we have water, tea, isotonic drinks…

Bottle from Bargain Booze, Sheffield. Smells awful like really cheap lager like Ace Lager.  Looks like pale lager, massive carbonation. Taste isn't much better. Overly gassy, wet cardboard taste and very sweet malty finish. I remembered where I had tasted similar beer; those bullshit "Bieres de Belgique" stubby lagers. Better than Bavaria alcohol free, but still absolute cack.
Can't tell the difference to most other non-alcoholic beers from big names brewers. Slightly watery, not too much taste, but drinkable.
Niby bezalkoholowe piwo, a tu miód, serio mega słodkie, poza tym tak naprawdę nic.
Bottle from Edeka Hamburg - clear golden, white head. thin body, taste is quite near to the original, not too much n/a sweetness here. carbonation is rather high. okay.
330ml can from Tesco. Golden colour with minimal white head. Aroma of lemon. Taste of grain and lemon. Recognisably a Heineken. OK.
One of the best n/a beers. Watery, but bitter and grainy. Some lemon and spices in the taste.
Can, Tesco, Wigston. Golden with a white head. Cereal malts with sudsy notes. Peppery. Crisp with some sharp lemon. Gassy. It's not bad.

Can, 0.33l. Aroma is grainy, grassy, worty, floral and slightly citrusy. Pours clear golden color with thin frothy white head and sparkling appearance. Tastes light sweet grainy, faint citrusy, grassy, vegetably and light bitter. Light body, thin texture and 
lively carbonation in palate. Quaffable, specially in terms of non-alco beers...
Okoliczności nie pozwalały na wykonanie notatek. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji

Aroma: levadura, cereal,
Aparencia: dorada, clara, Corona Blanca con buena retención, 
Sabor: dulce, poco amarga, cereal, 
Sensacion: delgada, poco carbonatada
Sehr guter Geschmack, so macht  Bier auch ohne Alkohol Spass. Herrlich zum trinken.
Smager som det det er. En Heineken uden alkohol. Virkelig dårlig øl, uden smag andet end den trælse.

Gedronken op het werk uit het blikje. Daardoor valt er over hoe het bier er uitziet niet zo veel te zeggen. Wat de smaak betreft komt voor mij weer de 'metaal-achtige' smaak naar voren die de smaak van een gewone Heineken vergezelt. Ik had er al snel genoeg van, maar dit is natuurlijk een goed alternatief voor de mensen die liever geen alcohol drinken. ik zou het bij een gewone Heineken houden.

Po info od kumpla sięgnąłem po tego bezalkoholowca, gdyż rzekomo produkowane w innowacyjnej technologii (że kasuje się aromat piwny w procesie produkcji i dodaje się tenże w sposób sztuczny). Cóż, w smaku rewolucji nie wyczułem, ugrzeczniony zwykły Heineken, raczej bez zapachu, w smaku... powiedzieć wodnisty, to nic nie powiedzieć. Słodowe i zbożowe piwo, lekko kwaskowe; wysycenie było w porządku. Wygląd ładny, klasyczny lagerek, nawet z lejsingiem. Faktycznie, taki produkt należy oceniać w porównaniu z jakimiś izotonikami albo innymi napojami, ale raczej nie piwem...

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Sample from can during tubing trip courtesy of Joe. Aroma was grassy, hay, malt. Taste was light bittersweet, caramel, grainy.
Smell of hay, malt. Pale golden colour, short white head. Aroma of straw, malt, some paper in finish. Lively short carbon. Surprisingly balanced. One of the better zeroes.

Klarowne z ładną pianą, choć pojawiają się grube bable. W aromacie zbożowe, słodowe i brzeczkowe. W smaku wodniste, kwaśne, zbożowe, słodkie. Przede wszystkim czuć jabłka. Zamiast goryczki mamy żelazistość na finiszu. Kiepskie, ale lepsze niż słodkie napoje. Na plus wyraźne nasycenie.

Inna warka lepsza, mało wyraziste, ale przyjemnie słodowe. Nie czuć brzeczki i nie czuć że to 0,0.

33cl can.
thin white head.  Clear golden pour.  Malty aftertaste.  Not bad for a 0.0% beer but I wouldn't drink another

@ Havregatan 20190810. Can (150 ml) from Scandic Nr 53.
Malty, grainy and bready, cardboard, sweet, light body with a watery texture. The finish is dry and bitter.
Can from scandic nr 53 in Stockholm, Sweden. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Malty and sweet with notes of cardboard. Dry sweet finish.
Great tasting non alcoholic beer. Light and refreshing. Good taste, a little bit bread-y. Perfect beer for a hot day, also perfect for the designated driver who wants the beer taste but no alcohol.

ya know, for an NA beer this is actually pretty decent. Doesn't have that NA taste. Heineken isn't my favorite anyway, but I thought I'd try it and was pleasantly surprised. A tad light in carbonation and mouthfeel but not bad at all. Head disappeared pretty quickly .Definitely a good summer lawnmower beer for when you don't need or want the alcohol.

Flaska 330 ml på Beer Hubb Pattaya Thailand. Ljust guldgul med vitt skum. Doft av malt och citrus. Smak av malt, bröd, apelsin och citrus. Markerad beska. En riktigt bra öl för att vara alkoholfri. 2 dagar med alkholförbud här i Thailand då det är Budistisk helg.

Barwa złota, klarowne, piana biała, niezbyt obfita, szybko znika. W aromacie słodowość. W smaku słodowe, czyste w profilu, nie jest brzeczkowe. Nie czuć chmielu, goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie, pijalne. Ujdzie.
Pours clear yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of acerbic malt. Taste is sweet, molasses and corn malt. Palate is continuation of these elements. Bad.

15cl can as a free sample. Clear, pale golden with a small, white head. Mild grainy and slightly fruity aroma with hints of candy and grassy hops. Sweet and watery, but somehow drinkable (at least a tiny can like this)
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.

Pale clear appearance with a frothy head. There are very good non-alcoholic beers out there, but this is the most watery beer I know. OK, it's very drinkable, but next time before ordering a Heineken 0,0, I'll order a glass of sparkling water.

Can at BeerFest Asia XI Edition, Singapore. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a short-lived fizzy white head. The aroma is malt, stale hops. The flavour is light sweet, with a light watery, cardboard, super light hop bitter palate. Light bodied with lively carbonation.  Thankfully I didn’t have to pay for this!

Botella 33 CL en la La taberna, pz mayor León 29..06..2019. (r196) 
Color amarillento ámbar transparente con fina capa de espuma blanca.
Sabores maltosos y cereales con suave amargo áspero y algún que otro herbaceo tendente a cítrico.
Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber algo seco. Comercial.
Corriente y molinete.
0,15 ml can for free at a Supermarket. Clear golden body with white head Aroma is malts hints of citrus. Taste is sweet malts. Aftertaste is grains. Never again

Dit is een prima 0,0-bier. Hop is duidelijk aanwezig, evenals tarwe. Frisser dan het gewone Heineken, door afwezigheid van maïs. Opvallend is ook de niet-moutige ondertoon, aangezien de meeste alcoholvrije bieren die wel hebben. 

Het is een redelijk alternatief voor gewone pils.

I was excited to see that Heineken was bringing their 0.0 beer to the United States finally after selling it for quite some time in Europe.

I finally got a hold of a 6 pack at my local Safeway.  It was $9 for a 6-pack.  

This is definitely my new favorite NA beer.  I actually like it better than regular Heineken. 

I've been trying to cut down on my Alcohol intake lately and this fits the bill perfectly.

It's pretty light, but very refreshing.  It would fool anyone in a blind taste test.

I was surprised that it had a decent head as well.
33cl Can. Golden pour white head. Aroma is sweet and grainy, toast. Flavor is metallic, grainy worty finish.
Can . A light yellow beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, straw, bread. The flavor is sweet with bites of bread.
Micro can@Jespers - light golden pour with a white head. Sweet corn and grassy hoppy, with notes of straw, papery cardboard, bitter grassy hoppy finish.
15 cl can. Pours clear and golden yellow, white head. Aroma is grainy and herbal. Flat malty, estery. Dry and cardboardish. Herbal estery finish.

Zlatnozute boje, bistro, tanka bijela pjena, kratkotrajna. Blage citrusne arome, kao i aroma vlaznog kartona. Blage gorčine, kratkog gorko-bljutavog finiša. Vodene teksture, srednje karbonizacije. Veoma loše!
Kurde to smakuje jak lekko kwasna lekko gorzka lekko slodka woda. Nie ma tego natretnego zapachu brzeczki jak w innych bez alkoholowych!!!
This is not beer! This is yellow water with some skim on top. Avoid at all cost!

From the green 11.2 fl. oz. bottle with a Feb 2020 expiration date.  The appearance is bright yellow with a foamy fading white head.  The malt breadiness plays up better than other N/A's in the aroma with a kind of zesty fruity note underneath.  But also a little soapy. There is a stake, cardboard-like breadiness in the flavor although I would still call it sweet.  Yet a clean finish. Better than some other N/A's I have had.

150ml can - Thanks Peeter! (3:2:4:2:8=1.9)

Stinky skunky aroma, a bit rotten. Pale. Light palate, a bit watery. Simple cornflakey and slightly branny taste, sweetish, some metal hints, but I was drinking straight from the can. Finish similar. I could drink this if I was desperate. Sauna stones liked it, nicely bready.

the aroma: malty and floral with shades of grain, esters and some herbs...
the taste: malty and herbal with notes of grain, straw, flowers and some grasses...
the aftertaste: herbal, dry...

I used to drink a lot of beer but decided to try dry January so I bought many different non and low alcohol beers. Most were either insipid or tasted of chemicals. 

I found a couple that were to my taste, and one was Heineken 0.0. 

If you like a clean tasting lager but want to cut down on your alcohol intake, or you have to drive then this is definitely worth a try.

Shared 12 oz. can poured to a snifter showing a clear, light gold color, with some soft white froth that reduced to a bubbly ring and light spots of lacing. The nose was soft grain, subtle Pils, and the lightest of lager scent. Ditto on the flavor, with fair carbonation, and thin texture. Pleased that no skunk arrived, but just a very light hydrator.

(Can) This was an odd one. My first comment is that it was very expensive, well over $8 for a six-pack, putting it above Clausthaler in price (IMHO they're the best of the best when it comes to NA beers) so I can't imagine buying this regularly. I bought it only only to try.

Tastes more like an alcoholic beer than most non-alcoholic beers I've tried. Creamy, light malty aroma with a light to moderate hoppiness. A hint of vanilla in the aroma. Carbonation is light but particularly evident, a little prickly, towards the finish. There is a moderate metallic taste the entire way through the sip. This tastes like real beer but it tastes like a decent cheap beer. It doesn't taste like real Heineken nor does it taste in the same category as my favorite NA brews.

I thought this tasted good but it tasted $5.50 a six-pack good, not $8.50 a six-pack good. And this price is with "natural flavors", something many of the competing brands don't resort to. The people who market this seriously need to revisit the pricing. Buckler is WAAAAY cheaper and IMHO a better beer, and in glass bottles to boot. And Clausthaler just burns them, and has three different options now. Why someone would buy this regularly is beyond me.

Pours bright gold into a shaker. White head with medium retention recedes to nothing. Sweet malt and meadow aromas. Soft with sweet hay and caramel upfront turning to earthy sourdough in the bitter finish.

Aroma: malty and some herbal notes.
Appearance: clear straw color and white head.
Taste: low herbal bitterness, watery, malty.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation.
Overall: acceptable non-alco lager.
A malty drop, a bit of an odd smell when I first opened the bottle. Prefer others.

Oh, aroma is really faint with little bit of malt and raggy signs. Taste is awful – it reminds your father's socks after long day at work. Don't try this, after all it settles on the belly not very good. Fckng close to (dirty) water.

Ein Bier, das ich freundlicherweise als 0,2l-Probedose vor einem WIener Supermarkt bekommen habe. So ersparte ich mir den Kauf. Mein Exemplar war übrigens ein Lizenprodukt aus der Brauerei Wieselburg. 
Es ist ein langweiliges Alkoholfreies ohne wirkliche Neuerung. 
Wenn man wenigstens die Drinkability des einfachen Heineken erhalten hätte...

0,33 L
Lose arome,prozirne boje,pjena oke..
Okus uzasan kao i kod svake bezalkoholne pive..
The best NA beer on the market - happy to be proven wrong, but for me, this is hard to beat right now.
Found out of bottle. Actually had a slightly better flavor than the standard version but still not great.
Lekko kwaśne w smakua le tak po za tym to prawie smakuje jak zwykłe piwo. Nawet ok

To begin with I love Summer Wheats but I'm no longer permitted to enjoy a taste of heaven on earth. At the time of this review Heinken 0.0. is the best NA I have purchased. The body is light, the aroma is middle of the road. The taste hits the spot. It is not bitter or sweet. A nice bit of fruitiness. I've given it in glassed to my friends and they had no idea it was an NA.

Aroma: Medium-light grainy, fruity. Slightly sweet.
Appearance: Brilliant, gold body. Medium, white head. Small bubbles. Fair retention. 
Flavour: Medium-light bitterness. Medium-light grainy. Light sweetness. Dry finish.
Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation. 
Overall: A clean, crisp, non-alcohol beer. Good to know that there are tasty alternatives if I have to drive the others home.

Can & Bottle, poured. 
2A. International Pale Lager

330 ml bottle into lager glass; bottled on 11/9/2018, best before 11/2019. Pours fairly crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, white bread dough, toasted biscuit, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. A bit of fruity/skunky aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, white bread dough, toasted biscuit, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, floral, woody, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, white bread dough, toasted biscuit, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great robustness and balance of pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and no lingering hop astringency after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with no fruity/yeasty notes. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth and moderately bready/grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Overall this is a delicious non alcoholic pale lager. Great robustness and balance of pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful and not watery. Very clean pils malt showcase, with great earthy noble hop presence/balance. A very enjoyable offering, and outstanding style example. Definitely the best NA beer I have had. The unique thing about it is there is none of the usual cardboard off flavor I've seen in other NA beers; so they are obviously doing some other type of brew process to remove the alcohol for this one.

Clear straw color with a thin foamy white head. Basic aroma if crackery pale malt and a subtle citrusy kiss. Crisp pale dry flavor that’s super light and gold makty. Lagery finish. Wouldn’t know it’s a 0% beer!
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Typowy słaby lager, tylko bardziej rozwodniony, plus kukurydziane i lekko brzeczkowe nuty.
2019 - 02 - 16  250ml twist-off bottle. light golden colour. small white head. cardboard in aroma. very light bitter taste.

Savagely underrated. Clear green bottle. Grass, hay and honey aroma. Realistic honeyed heft, bitter bite, hay and lemon candy. Pretty obvious the ‘natural flavourings’ include bee shit, and it becomes increasingly outspoken as warms. Still, a nice (and beery) tasting beverage. 4x 330ml gone with no complaints. Bit calorific considering, but that’ll be the bee shit. Almost made me want to chop some wood.

Bottle at home while lifting some weights.   Pours standard macro yellow. Light nose of cardboard, hops, and malt sweetness. Tastes of crackers, light hops, dry hay. Not as sweet as regular Heineken.  Mellow and crisp. Obviously light bodied. Not bad for no alcohol.

Pale straw with thin white head that dissolves into suds. Aroma is thin and lagery. Not really much taste, maybe slight corn or bitterness? Palate is crispy, refreshing, slightly bitter. Not good, not bad either.
Bottle oro limpida schiuma media media persistenza cereale dolciastra cartone niente Luppolo
Can of Russian Heineken 0. Aroma is metallic, tastes too sweet, but at least looks nice. Probably much better ice cold and during summer.

Bought a single 330ml bottle from BWS.
Initial smell was awful - some sort of weird cheese smell. Battled through that to have a drink straight from bottle (not about to bring out the glassware for this). Initial taste actually very similar to normal Heineken. The flavour gives way a lot sooner to go watery, but actually a lot less sweet than other products like the Budvar version. Not a bad effort. Would be happy to drink this over mineral water to mix it up.
Een van de betere alcoholvrije bieren. Niet dat hij zo goed is, maar de andere zijn zo slecht...
Free can picked up by a friend at a railway station. Loads of veg, thin palate, odd bitterness. Not undrinkable but really not good.

Pours a very pale yellow with minimal head. Aroma is not too bad considering Heineken original and the fact that it's a 0% beer. A little straw, lemon and plastic. Taste is sugary sweet, with vegetable notes and a thin, watery finish.

Better than expected.
Aroma is slight skunk and malts.  The flavor is malts, slight fruit and a slinky/beery finish.

Can sampler picked up free at Euston station. Light bright golden colour, nice white bubbles. Not too bad really, lightly sweetly malts and some floral citrusy notes, ok balance on the bitterness front. Pleasant enough for what it was.

0,5l can. Clear pale yellow colour with immediately disappearing white head. Aroma: Dough with a skunky tone. Taste: Malty sourish taste with soft buttery texture. Very light body with fizzy carbonation. Long lasting strong sourish finish. Not good low alcohol beer but better than the original Heineken.

Can from supermarket. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, malts, grass and a bit of hops. Bitter finish with citrus, malts, a bit of hops, grass and a bit of toast. Good non-alcoholic beer.

Clear pale color with white head. Aroma is like all pale lagers, malty and grainy. Taste is also close to an alcoholic lager, but the finish is more watery. It`s drinkable when you want to drink and drive.

Can, 330ml. Pale straw colour, small white head. Aroma initially citrus, giving way to public toilet. Flavour has rice, not much else. Some distant malt notes, very watery finish. Light carbonation. Fizzy water that smells bad.

Bottle from BWS on 1 January 2019. For a no alcohol beer this was quite good and to tell the truth I couldn’t really tell any difference between this and normal Heineken - not sure if that is a good thing or not.
Free can from Nemlig.com. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty, cardboard and corn. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. Watery. 281218
It is not the best low alcohol beer , but it is decent and it is drinkable.
330ml bottle with lunch. Pale gold with a fluffy white head. Pretty standard alcohol free lager, not too sweet though which is often the case. I've had worse "proper" lagers!

Bottled 0,33L. Pale yellow color, limpid and gaunt aspect, watery, evanescent and escaping head resistance. Pale straw and sweet grains aroma. Very simple and watery taste, unpleasant sweet cereals and dampen straw, inconsistant and corn body.

Nov 2018 - 330ml can at home as 'Heineken 0.0', 0% alcohol, BB Aug 2019.  "Premium Quality", apparently, which everyone knows is synonymous with "cheap generic corner-shop lager" - why marketing teams still approve this phrase is beyond my comprehension.  Pale golden yellow, clear, sparkling, foamy dense off-white head dies quite quickly.  Aroma is sawdust and cat paws, faint carpet underlay and old bubblegum.  Body is smooth with tingly carbonation.  Taste has some steely metal and cardboard, touches of old tarnished antique teaspoon and light estery peardrop and bubblegum notes.  Quite quenching actually.  Semidry.  This is not at all bad.  It is totally genuinely an alcohol-free lager rather than a soft drink made up to taste like a lager.  One of the most authentically lager-like alcohol free beers I've ever had.  The execution is flawless, in all fairness.  You have to admire that.  Maybe gets a touch too estery and dry late on.  But, overall, one of the best in its class I'd say. (5-4-5-3-8=2.5)

Z koncernowych piw 0.0 chyba najlepsze. Aromat jest ewidentnie sztuczny który kojarzy mi się z biszkoptem ale skutecznie zabija wszystko co mogłoby być złe. W smaku dosyć nijakie co w zasadzie dla tego typu piw jest plusem.

33cl bottle on 2nd Nov 2018. Drank in 'The Morning Light Pub' on the cruise ship Braemar as it steamed back to the UK (I was driving my car the next day and needed to calm my drinking down). I actually enjoyed this! Pale golden body, clean, clear and bright; fast fading white wisp for a head. Grainy and malty in nature and not unpleasant, light bitterness too. A lot better than some low/no-alcohol beers I have had thrust upon me over the years.
Bottle sample at Jenia's place. Grainy, paper, a bit of apple, sweetish, bitterish finish, light-bodied, fizzy.
Voor een 0.0 bier smaakt dit best prima. Mist ten opzichte van normaal pils wel veel smaak en aroma. maar dit bier is zeker niet verkeerd. -backlog de BierApp-
From a can, Golden, small head. Aroma is sweaty feet, malt, grain. Taste is malt, grain, weird aroma like wtf…

Rami Rami is drinking a Heineken 0.0 by Heineken at Powiśle

Megawodniste, nieco cukrowo-kukurydziane, jakis dziwny niedopieczonegonciasta. Ale nie ma jakiejs tragedii, ciut goryczki ma, mokry, zimny
Terribile il gusto..... manco facendoci della radler diventa bevibile. Non la prenderò più

Rather amazed to be given a (decent sized) free sample of this on entering Tesco - I got the impression Heineken are doing a big push on it. Its a pale yellow-gold with a white head. Up front it's not too bad - light and frothy with light lemon and a hint of grass. It is very watery though, and sweetcorn soon takes over with some metal and cardboard notes, and it leaves an unpleasant aftertaste. It's everything I expected and less. I'm glad I didn't pay for it, but even so I'm still not sure I got value for money. Still, I'm grateful that this sample means I'll never have to drink a full can.

330 ml green bottle, from Helgø Meny Maxi, Sandnes. Crystal clear pale golden colour, moderate white head. The aroma has first some fresh and typical Heineken notes of lightstruck hops, before the more usual n/a beer features of cooked vegetables and baby porridge take over, but not as extreme as in some other n/a beers. Thin mouthfeel as expected. The flavour is fairly dry with some hops, and the beer is not undrinkable, okay with a meal.
Can. Thanks to thomas A. Shared with Rekvium. Pours clear pale piss yellow with a ehite head. Corn and maize. Papery touch. Enormously watery.

Definitely had to try this one. Pours clear golden, medium nonlasting white foamy head. No real aroma, just some corn notes and a bit of cardboard - not too smelly I guess. Taste is sweet. Metallic finish. Very watery body. No real nose, no taste, no body. Still, had worse, I guess.

Barwa jasnozłota, idealnie klarowne. Piana drobnopęcherzykowa, niska, mało trwała.
Aromat: mocno słodowy, jak zwykły Heineken.
W smaku pustka,  jakaś dziwna sztuczność, jabłko..tfu.
Wysycenie wysokie.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy cardboard flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy finish.

33cl can at home. Pours a clear golden colour with a lot of visible carbonation and a small soapy white head which rapidly vanishes. Aroma of wet dog, typical low alcohol beer smell, slight citrusy. Taste is medium to moderate sweet, soft bitter with a soft dry finish. Notes of pale malt, slight caramel, slight apple juice. Texture is oily to watery, light bodied with moderate carbonation

color is golden straw

taste is straw
mouthfeel is watery with flat carbonation.
restraint, low sweetness

0,3 litre Bottle from ICA Maxi Hamar. Clear  light Golden with white head. Malts, hops and Sweet. Nice for an alcohol Free Beer.

Can @ Home. Pours very pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, light grain, little corn, light grass. Flavor is sweet, malt, grain, corn, light grass, light cardboard. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 170818

Bottle sample at Rozner, Kfar Saba. Clear pale yellow with white head. Sweetish aroma with mainly notes of malt and cereal. The flavor is sweet and mild bitter with notes of malt, quite diluted and watery, some hops. Light-bodied.
Butelka 0,5 litra. Cóż za szczoch to ja piernicze. Najgorsze co mogło mi się zdarzyć.

330 ml bottle. At the Jerun Piilopaikka, Tampere, Finland. EHUK. Enjoyed on June 9 2018.

Aroma malt, eple, humle. Utseende klar lys gylden med hvitt skum. Smak malt, humle, noe frukt. Lett fylde, lite av alt, men den er alkoholfri... Flaske kjøpt på Friend Luleå, 33cl 0%

0,5 can. Színe átlagos lager, habja is olyan mint a "rendes" Heinekené. Az illata malátás, és van valami furcsa édeskés mellékzönge. Ízre citrusos, komlót is érezni, de sajnos elég vizes. Its color is average lager, head is also like that of the "ordinary" Heineken. Aroma is  malty and has some weird sweet side note. It tastes citrusy, hops too, but unfortunately quite watery. A strange medicinal taste mixes with the lemon flavor. Not the worst non-alcoholic, but not the best. Based on its foam, it may have real dry matter in it.
From bottle, small bublly head, clear quite intense yellow color , not too appealing, dough and vanila aroma, quite sour and thin, flavor of apple, wort and honey. Not good to say the least.
Sips from a bottle 330 ml at Ladbroke Arms. Malts and water. Extremely boring beer.
At home with Bart from my work gold blond colored body with a white head and with a herby malt aroma A herby malt sweet watery bitter taste with a slight bitter finish

Eindelijk was hij er dan, het alcoholvrije bier van Heineken dat wèl goed te drinken is,
nou ja.....redelijk. Dankzij de unieke A gist die je zowel in de geur en smaak tegenkomt, is het een slappe variant van de pilsener.
Smaak is redelijk vol, zoete mout, beetje hopbitter en behoorlijk wat Co2.
Over de geur gaan we het niet hebben, want die vind ik zelf niet bijzonder, alhoewel er aan deze meer karakter zit dan andere alcoholvrije bieren.

Barwa słomkowa, klarowne, piana obfita. Aromat praktycznie niewyczuwalny, smak słodowy, można wyczuć również aromaty. Goryczki praktycznie brak, nasycenie średnie. Słabe na tle konkurencji.

A surprisingly good low alcohol beer, pours a clear gold color with lasting white well laced head, aroma is bready with some sweet grain notes, the taste is sweet, with notes of corn and bread, full bodied with a sweet malt finish.
Bottle, 0.0% at Censormøde 18. Bready aroma, a little malt syrupy. Clear golden colour. Good stable white head. The flavour is slightly papery with a fairly low bitterness. Good for the style.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with airy but stable white head. Clear aroma of yeast and malt, with some citric touches. Sweetish, malty and estery flavour with bitterish notes of hops. Sweetish, estery aftertaste. Not that bad for the style, but not very inspiring, either.

"Piwo" numer jeden, jeśli chodzi o całkowicie niepijalne badziewie. Ohydny, chemiczny aromat, ale smak jeszcze gorszy, sztuczny, nieprzypominający piwa. Mokry karton, emulsja, stęchlizna, gnijąca mokra kukurydza, wszystko co najgorsze. Zdecydowanie najgorsze bezalkoholowe piwo jakie piłem i prawdopodobnie też najgorsze spośród całej reszty.
Jedno z gorszych bezalkoholowych piw na rynku. Omijać szerokim łukiem. Poza odrobiną słodowości czuć tutaj taką słodkawą, chemiczną nutę, która dodatkowo pogrąża to piwo.

Słomkowe, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, znika całkowicie i błyskawicznie. Aromat i smak słodowy plus jakaś nieprzyjemna nuta, ale nie umiałem jej zidentyfikować. Dość słodkie. Nasycenie niskie, ew. średnio-niskie. Goryczki brak.

to piwo jak nazwa wskazuje powinno tez miec moja ocene na Zero, ale wyszlo jak wyszlo. Piana spora poczatkowo, ale znika szybciej niz porsche wjezdzajacy na najwyzszym biegu do tunelu. Barwa jasna niemal slomkowa, smakowo slomiasto wodniste, posmak mydlin z mydla, ochydztwo, ale najzabawniejszy jest napis: warzone w Austrii, rozlewane w Zywcu pod nadzorem Heinekena z Amsterdamu:) nie zdziwilbym sie jakby dopisali: etykietowano na Mauritusie, a kapslowano na Marsie:)
C'est bien une Heineken, on reconnaît certaines caractéristiques de la célèbre bouteille verte mais on a très vite l'impression d'avoir en bouche une limonade ou un panaché...

Hard to distinguish from the normal pils, if you don't drink them consecutively. Aroma is mostly citrus. I am not sure if these are the hops or the aromas that are added, according to the bottle. A little sweet, but not too bad, compensated by the bitter taste, that is just right. Not a bad non- alcoholic beer

Bottle pours clear golden with white head, but that's the only strong point. Aroma heavily malty, bit steamed vegetables, not quite nice. Taste nothing special. Soft carbo. OK, it's a NA pilsener from a big brand, but still not nice.
500ml can. Drinkable. Taste is rather sweet, there is hop only in track. Biscuit, malt you can feel with some ginger(?). Not really bad.

Appearance: Clear golden. Some fizzy white head.

Aroma: Very pale malt, some grains.

Taste: Grains, cheap malt, slight metal, some sweetness.

Bought: Halle aux Boissons (Matran), 150 ml can, CHF 0.00

Info: 15/5-2018, BB: 30/11-2018

0,33l can @ Hedåsen, a friend's wedding. Pours pale golden with a medium head. Aroma is grainy malts. Flavor is pale watery malts with a slightly hoppy note. Drinkable. (42427) (120518)
(050619) Re-rate @ Bier-bier, blind tasting. Awful. Glue, metal. No beer.

Waarom ..... t is dat de oudste deze crap bij een kratje heineken kreeg, ik zou het zelf nooit kopen, en dat blijkt na een paar slokken dan ook meer dan terecht, t ziet eruit en smaakt naar paardenpis, afgeroomde ochtend urine doordrenkt
Met een maiskolf en weeïge mout. Man man man kansloos deze Bocht

Tasting can at Carrefour in Milan, not poured. Strong bread and biscuity malts on the nose. In the mouth, lower than average carbonation, more bread and biscuity malts, no real hop presence, some sweetness. Overall, another overly malty zero-alcohol lager, dull as old concrete.

12.01.2019 Aromat czuć chmiel ale raczej słabo, bardziej słodowy. Piana jest ale znika kolor jasno złoty. Smak jest tu wyraźne nuta słodowa aczkolwiek to tylko nuta i ogólnie piwo jest bez smaku, chmielu właściwie nie czuć. Piwo jest dosyć wodniste nie ma tu za wiele ciał oraz ma wysokie nasycenie. Ogólnie jakby było czuć bardziej chmiel to mogło by być.

01-05-2018; can; at home (bought at Plus 's Gravenland, Capelle aan den IJssel, The Netherlands).
The beer looks like any other Pilsener or Pale Lager. The beer is golden yellow, crystal clear and has a crispy white head. Bubbles arise to the top lively. Not very special, but it looks normal. 
The smell of the beer is fine. It isn't a very special smelling beer, but it is smelling like beer. I smell some nice sweet bready mals and quite some herbal hops. The yeast is quite prominent and gives a slightly meat like aroma. All in all, a simple smelling beer, but you wouldn't directly tell it is a 0.0% beer. 
The same goes for the taste. Sweet malts, nice hoppy bitterness and some slightly meaty yeast touches. The yeast is a bit different than in 'real' beer, so this is an indicator of this being a non-alcoholic one. But the flavours are well balanced.
The palate is fine. Light body, thin and high carbonation. The finish is short and isn't strong at all. It has some hoppy bitters in it. All in all, a simple Pilsener, but for a alcohol free beer I think it is really good. In a blind test I wouldn't be able to tell this is an alcohol free Pilsener.

Bezalkoholowy Heineken ma złotą barwę i idealną klarowność. Piana niewielka, biała, poszarpana. Aromat niewyraźny, słodowy. Trochę cuchnie... W smaku jest naprawdę kiepsko. Wodniste, słodowe na granicy wyczuwalności. Wysycenie średnie. Różne piłem bezalkoholowe, ale to jest naprawdę paskudne...

355 ml can. Pours a clear pale golden colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma of wet straw and grains. Flavour has similar character with a bit of a metallic note. Limp body. Pretty much what I’d expected.

Can. 0.0%. Best before 12.18. Brewed in Denmark? Pours a clear, pale yellow, with a creamy (off)-white head. Decent lacing. A bit sharp aroma, sweetish, cereals, light hops. Dusty overtone. Fruit and a light plastic/rubber note as it warms. Flavour is cereals. Light metallic, dusty overtones. Mildly bitter finish, a wee bit dry. Lingering overripe fruit note and a hint of apple. Overall not particularly good. 28.04.18.

Bottle from Merkur Hoher Markt in Vienna. Pours bright gold with a large white head. The aroma of Heineken wafts from the pour. SaAroma of bread and some noble hop. Med minus minus body. Flavor is bready with noble hop. Made me think of the old “Near Beer” - which had 0.5% as I recall back over 4 decades. I will declare that Heineken has succeeded in producing a relatively tasteless lager to match the flavor of their relatively tasteless traditional lager. This will be handy when water is not available.
AirBnB rating, bottle from a supermarket in Haarlem. Clear golden yellow color, white coca cola head. Straw aroma. Taste starts sweet, then light cardboard.
330ml bottle. Clear yellow color. Medium size, white head, stays. Hop extract, sweet in aroma. Sweet, jammy, hop extract in taste. Fizzy carbonation. Sweet meh brew.
Jest to ohydztwo na miarę swojego alkoholowego bliźniaka, lepiej już naprawdę napić się wody. Smutek i trwoga.
Faint aroma of malt and wort. Very watery, thin, a bit malt, grain and wort in taste.

Bottle @ Home. 

Pours pale straw colored with a frothy white head. 

Aroma is malty, corny. 

Taste thin and Watery and very weak. Some malty notes and just about no bitterness. 

Easily one of the worst Alc free beers Ive had.
Słomkowej barwy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita. Dosyć trwała. Aromat słodowy. W smaku bardzo wodniste z delikatnym słodowym akcentem.

Pours with a lasting pillow of white head and medium golden body. Aroma is strong on the rotten hops with some sweet bread behind it. Flavour is soft bread, baked baguettes, followed by a subdued mouthfeel that is not too watery. Quite average, whichbis quite good for a zero alcohol beer.
Can from Sarkynorthener cheers Martin; clear yellow pour with a thin, aroma has sweet malts, taste has light malts, ok in a no alcohol sort of way.

Bottle at work!!!! Zo uit de fles, maar ongetwijfeld was het helder en goudkleurig. Geurt zoetig, granig, fruitig, als Heinken eigenlijk. Smaakt ook een beetje zo. Dunne body. Vleugje bitterheid in de afdronk. Ach, als het moet....
Bottle at Owens Restaurant & Bar, Ramsbottom. Golden with a carbonation and no head. It has a malty nose with a lesser stated malty taste, and also a crispness.
Clear light golden colour with medium white head, aroma is sweet malt , taste is corn , slight malty , no bitterness , light sweetmess, metal, thin mouthfeel.

Straw, nice, tall foam. Smell sweet, characteristic for low-alcohol beers, no skunk! Tastes of corn, grains, no bitterness whatsoever somewhat sweet. In spite of that it is kind of drinkable, like watery-drinkable. No reason to buy it again.

Une blonde translucide t une mousse éphémère. Un nez de corps gras; de beurre, ainsi que d'herbes mouillées et de sucre raffiné. Les saveurs sont horribles. Du malt détrempé et du gazon. Légèrement effervescent. (2445-120218)
Bottle. Aroma typical to lager beer, malty. Apperanece clear. Taste no bitter, light sweetness. Palate slick feel, flat. Overll on of the best non alcohol beer.

Sample. Well, the representative from Heineken started by saying alcohol free will never be as good, and he is right. Decent at first but cardboard aftertaste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can. Clear golden body with a small white head. Grains, malty, waterish mouthfeel. It is wat it is.

Lata. Clear thin golden color, medium white head, steady and creamy. Aroma of grains and brewing mash with something citrus like underneath. Thin palate, water. Flavour is quite mild, grainy, mild brewing mash, cereal, mild citrus like touch, Hardly any bitterness. Not a as bad at all as I suspected but a very mild thin watery brew. Good alc. free brew actually.
Pours clear pale yellow with low white head. Aromas of malty dish water, some syrupy bread, light herbal. Taste has watery and light malty notes and some sweet fruits
Can as free sample from asda and shared with bjammin. Piss coloured water, no head. Aroma of cereal grain and pale malts. Taste is cereal grain, pale malts and perfume. Blah.

Sample can given to me a Liverpool Street station and drunk at home. It actually looked like lager in the glass and there was a very faint taste of a macro lager in the flavour. The mouthfeel was very watery and I really didn't enjoy it.

Nouveauté au Québec, j’ai bien hâte de voir si elle sera supérieure à sa concurrente (sans alcool) Becks. Je la bois à la bouteille comme je le ferais avec une vraie Heineken! Je dois dire que je suis agréablement surpris! La Becks a un petit goût désagréable qui me tombe un peu sur les nerfs mais pas celle-ci, elle est très rafraîchissante et se rapproche de la Heineken alcoolisée dont le petit goût caractéristique réussit à se présenter (subtilement mais sûrement). Une des meilleures alternatives lagers que j’ai bues sans le moindre doute. Parfaite pour le dry January! Cheers! (Le score que je donne est relatif et tient compte très favorablement du fait que c’est une bière sans alcool!)
I was sceptical as im not a heinekin lover but this beer really surprised me. No strange NA flavours, good carb and slight zingy aftertaste. Refreshing.

Bottle. Color: Light yellow golden, fast disappearing white head. Taste: Very malty, wort, like all non alcoholic lagers. Lightly bitter. Cardboard. Pretty watery, light body. Average carbonation. Slightly better than most other non alcoholic beers, but still not even close to a lager with alcohol.
330 ml bottle. clear yellow color with small thin white head. smells nice like normal pale ale. taste are almost similar to normal Heineken 5%. not bad as non alcoholic beer.
Dorée très claire, aucune mousse. Nez legerement malté. Gout malté doux industriel et note de grains. Bon ya qd meme un leger gout.... m'attendais a pire

can.
clear yellow, smooth white head.
citrussy aroma, very faint malts.
sweet malts, artificical sweet flavor, artificial preservatives citrussy note. what hops? this is a fairly bad low alc. (3,3,4,3,7)
re-rate 2018-12-05
can from kvickly.
clear yellow, large smooth white head. 3
aroma is mostly citrussy, with a flowery note below that. not much dough or cereral, that's nice for a change. 4
flavor is strangely sugary sweet with flowery notes, a weird but almost acceptable bitterness towards the end, body is not that thin. 
if you can get used to the citrussy tint to the flavor this non alc is always decent for a non alc beer. 4
palate 3
overall 6

Lets be honest non alcoholic lager never going to be worth reviewing like a craft ale. I LOVE my beer but i dont want to be drinking all the time. Ive tried most zero % options but this is far and away the best of them. Slightly sweet its not trying to be heineken but is instead its own drink. Refreshing .
33cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of cereals, bread, sweet malt. taste of breadish sweet malt, corn, mild spicy hops.

Jako svijetlo žuto zlatna boja. Nema pjene, po okusu se skuži da je bezalkoholna, ima onaj šugavo sladni okus, ali ne prejak. Ipak mi više vuče na pravu pivu, tako da je za jednu bezalkoholnu i dosta dobro.
Bottle looks very simple. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, malty, a bit moldy. Some metallically notes. Finish still mild, less moldy. Okay.

330 ml bottle. Pours with a clear, light golden color and a meidum size white head. Nose ist grainy, sweet cereals, grassy with some soapy aorma. taste follows the nose and leaves in an bitter-dry finish (which is simply the best)...
Can from Tesco, Gateshead. Pale golden with a rapidly disappearing thick white head. It has a grassy, slight herbal and soapy flavour followed by a bitter-sweet, thin finish. Pretty good for the ABV.
Was served Heineken 0.0 as a Heineken and didn't taste the difference. Only when drinking a normal Heineken afterwards there was a slight but minimal difference.
not even close to other really tasty non alcoholic beers. low on carbs tho. tastes a bit watered and flavors are really superficial, no depth, but I drank worse alcohol free beers
Bottle at Escape, Amsterdam: Clear golden colored non-alcoholic beverage, with an slightly sweety taste and not that dull taste usually with non-alcoholic beer.

De las cervezas sin alcohol que he probado es de las mejores no tiene ese
amargor que tienen la mayoría y que las hace difíciles de beber.
Eso sí, tomándose muy fría.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ home shared by Inoven. Clear golden color, small white head that disappears instantly. Smell and taste both are sweet, sweet grainy sugars, dust, cardboard. Low body and carbonation.
Flesje gedeeld met Benzai. Goudgeel helder bier zonder schuim. Geur van mout smaak is waterig.

Straight from the bottle. Actually, this brew is okay as non-alcoholic beer. Carbonation pushing grassy and metallic flavors. It helped to wash down the food anyway. And it’s not so even worse than its alcoholic version.
Geproefd vanaf fles, een goudgeel pils met een witte schuimkraag. Het heeft een gistachtige geur. En een waterige smaak.
Clear golden color with white head. Chilled not bad as a Thirst Quencher without alcohol.

15 cl. promotion can. Clear golden colour with a thin white head. Sweet aroma with grasses, grains and brewing mash. Taste is sweet. Light body with a thinner texture and an average carbonation. Finishes slightly sweet with grasses and sweet fruits. A touch of grasses. Not at all bad for a macro 0.0 beer.
Bottle. Pale golden color, white head. Slightly sharp aroma of vegetation with hoppy notes. Fairly clean, malty flavor. Light body, medium carbonation. Not bad for being non-alcoholic.
Canned. Pale yellow, thin head. Not good, obviously, but neither is any macro NA beers I’ve tried so far. Didn’t expect any more, tho.

This beer is an odd one, taste is very sticky and sweet compared to the regular Heineken. Doesn’t settle well in the stomach, looks good on the glass. I’d drink along with a meal, good entry-beer for young ones to see if they are interested in trying real craft. Can’t lie, this is one of the better N.A. beers.

Bottle from Victa, made in Bräu Union Österreich, shared with heavy. Clear golden body, almost no head. Smells a little like stale yoghurt, grainy. Light honeyish body. Dry, vaguely citric and salty. Not terrible technically but faaar from good.

Bottle.. waste of my money but it’s a thick. Looks are pretty decent, clear pale golden with a bubbly white head on top. Aroma of sugars. wort and grains. Flavor is sweetish, malty with an extremely watery body and medium carbonated. Just disgusting...
Uiterlijk: helder en doorzichtig. Koolzuurgehalte: gematigd. Geur:  moutig van karakter. Smaak:  niet al te hoppig. Balans neigt naar zoet

33cl can, brewed in France. Grainy bready beginning. No bitterness, easy to drink with not too much flavour at all. Malty bready body, sweetish soft, sessionable with more water than beer. Weak with no aftertaste.

Maandag 24 juli 2017 van 30 cl fles, geproefd in Hotel Postillon Dordrecht.
Helder blond bier met witte kraag.
Aroma: zoet, granig-moutig, in de verte wat fruit. Licht mondgevoel.
Smaak: zoet, klein beetje fruit, granig, zeer vlak en waterig, miniscuul beetje hopbitter.

Bottled 330ml. -from local Interspar Karlovac. Clear pale golden coloured, small airy white head, whiff of grain in the nose. Sweetish water with touch of grain and corn. Almost tasteless, not offensive just useless.

4/VII/17 - 25cl green bottle from a Dutch supermarket @ lunch break at work - BB: XI/17 (2017-969) 


Clear orange beer, small aery white head, unstable, non adhesive, dissipates quickly. Aroma: grains, cow fodder, bit sweet, metallic touch, bit fruity, some peaches. MF: lively carbon, medium to light body. Taste: little fruity, bit sourish, bit metallic, grains, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: bitter touch, fruity, grains, cow fodder, hay, bit malty, metallic.
Bottle from Coop at Marieberg. Light smell, fruity with apples. Similar taste. Very light body. A bit artificial but also no clear off flavours.

Eerste indruk me eerste alcohol vrije biertje en echt dit valt me zoooo niet tegen :-). Zijn van ver gekomen sinds Buckler bier maar als dit het begin van de nieuwe toekomst voor alcoholvrij bier is, dan ben ik een gelukkig man en heel benieuwd hoe ver dit nog gaat komen. Zowaar namelijk de eerste keer dat ik een biertje zonder alcohol proef die lekker smaakt zonder meteen jamaar te roepen. Oke klein minpuntje het ruikt net nog niet helemaal optimaal ergens toch een subtiel hintje van een ouwe krant. Hier is nog werk aan de winkel!!! Maar heeft een heldere gele kleur met schuimkraag al is ie niet heel sterk maar smaakt gewoon als pils met zelfs een bittertje. Perfect alternatief als je moet autorijden i.p.v. die suikerbommen die ze tegenwoordig radler noemen. Het is nog geen Heineken ;-) maar beter als menig biertje met alcohol. Fles
Canned from Mercadona. Malty, slightly sweeter than the regular version. Could drink this when designated driver.
Can. Clear golden liquid. Moderate brief froth. Sweetish grainy aroma. Minimal skunk. Light body. Clean grains on tongue. Some chemical bitterness finishing. Not bad for NA macro.

Russian version at 0.5% ABV. 500ml(?) can. Pours clear gold with a small and short-lived white head. Aroma is malt, corn, lemon. Taste is sweet and grainy, small bitterness in the finish. Surprisingly drinkable and somewhat similar to regular Heineken.
33 cl. bottle. A clear golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, straw and watery.

Российская лицензия (бутылка 0,5)
А Ведь не мерзко.
Probada de tirador la verdad es que ni muy fría se arregla parecen los meados de una Heineken normal

Smells like a sour sock. Light citrus and a little malt flavor. Minimum bitterness that disappears quickly. The beer is drinkable but is not at all good. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Can. Golden color. Aroma of water and malt mostly. Taste has malt and water, somewhat bitter unpleasent finish. Typical non alcohol lager. Not that different from the normal one.

330ml bottle shared by djoeye. Bright straw coloured body. Diminishing white head, fragile lacing. Gets vegetable and grass on the nose. Vague moments of lime to the taste buds. Diluted. Below par for a none alcohol beer. (Rating session at Finn’s. Tromsø 18.05.2017).

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear yellow pour with minimal white head, short lasting. Malts, grains and corn on the nose.

Thin body, medium carbonation, light and watery texture. Taste is moderately bitter with some tart notes. Aroma actually quite ok, pretty much your average macro lager. Malty, grainy, hint of lemon. Some metal in the aftertaste. No finish to speak of.

Overall, ok for what it is. Not particularly good, but not offensive either.
330ml Dose. Klar und golden mit mittelgroßer Schaumkrone. Sehr wässrig. Leicht getreidig. Milder Geschmack.
Tried at the Three Horseshoes, Waddington. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma and taste are light citrus to light sweet. Thin body.

330ml bottle from Hemköp Hornstull. Clear pale golden. Medium size white head, weak lacing. Sweet grainy and malty aroma, grass and bread. Light and clean mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Mid-sweet grainy taste, crisp bread, grass and red apples. Lacks bitterness.
330ml bottle from Park Eat, Reading University. Cereal, grains, grass, some lemon, some mint, slightly metallic, thin and watery body, much better than expected for a low alcohol macro lager though.

Bottle from Daglivs. 
Pours clear golden with a white head. 
Aroma of bread and lemon. 
Clean, sweet, light bitterness and a little grass and metal.

Bottle from coop
Pale clear yellow, white head 
Aroma of honey, hops, grass.
Taste sweet and fruity. Some bitterness quite thin. Hint of mint. Ok
Flaske 330ml spandert av djoeye. Delt med ham og Rune på Nerstranda 18 Mai 17. Gyldengul. Lavt tett skum. Aroma av papp. Smaken det samme. Meget anonym.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into small mug.
Appearance: Clear golden colour, with small short-lived head. 
Aroma: Grains, malt
Palate: Watery, light body, gentle carbonation.
Taste: Water, citrus, hint of sourness.
Overall impression: Quite good for non-alcoholic beer, drinkable and refresing; better than regular Heineken.

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is grainy malt with only lighly wort and a hint of grassy hops. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Body is light to medium. Not a bad non-alc macro lager at all, not a sweetish wort-bomb. Drinkable for the style.

Aroma; caramel, grass, sweet grain. 
Look; off white head, pale golden body. 
Taste; grass, caramel and bread. Quite dead finish.
Feel; thin body, ok co2. Overall; alright as 0-abv, but thin stuff.
[33cl.btl abv0.0% # B@Kilpishalli 2€ T@hafen&biere Finn’s]

33cl Can. Clear pale golden colour, white head. Aroma is light sweet, light malty, light metallic, hint of grass. Flavour is light sweet, dry, relatively bitter, thin, aluminium, light bitter finish. Light bodied, watery. Not convinced, but at least it’s not canned wort as most N/A’s used to be.

330 ml bottle at home. Crystal clear golden with quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is malty, slight candy, slight apple juice and faint doughy notes. Taste is similar, malty, slight tart, apple sauce and candy. Not too bad for a 0,0

20170505 HOME; 25 cl bottle BB sep 17; A nice yellow clear beer with a good white head, which becomes thin. A malty aroma, even light sweet. The taste is somewhat malty with a bitterness in aftertaste. At hte background also some sweetness. But the body is thin, even somewhat watery.

0.33 l can from ’AH’ (Groesbeek), best before August 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Very faint, sweetish and slightly grainy aroma of wort and hints of straw. Sweetish, slightly grainy and quite chemical taste of grains, wort and some bubblegum (?), followed by a short, slightly bitter, grainy and slightly chemical finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not very nice, liked the Amstel 0.0 way better.
